answer:
Sure. Here is the answer to your question:

The official languages spoken in Canada are English and French. In addition, Canada has a diverse immigrant population, which has resulted in the use of a wide range of other languages. Some of the most common immigrant languages spoken in Canada include Chinese, Punjabi, Tamil, Cantonese, Urdu, Vietnamese, Italian, Cantonese, and Tagalog.
